action.action-desc: Mr. Golden (for himself, Mr. Gimenez, Mr. Fitzpatrick, and Mr. Kildee) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 to authorize appropriations for the United States Fire Administration and firefighter assistance grant programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fire Grants and Safety Act.

section.header: Reauthorization of the United States Fire Administration
section.text: Section 17(g)(1) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2216(g)(1)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (M), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: $95,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2030, of which $3,420,000 for each such fiscal year shall be used to carry out section 8(f).

section.header: Reauthorization of assistance to firefighters grants program and the fire prevention and safety grants program

subsection.text: Section 33(r) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2229(r) is amended by striking 2024 and inserting 2032.
Section 33(q)(1)(B) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2229(q)(1)(B)) is amended, in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking 2023 and inserting 2030.

section.header: Reauthorization of staffing for adequate fire and emergency response grant program

subsection.text: Section 34(k) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2229a(k)) is amended by striking 2024 and inserting 2032.
Section 34(j)(1)(I) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2229a(j)(1)(I)) is amended, in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking 2023 and inserting 2030.
